messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Question...
messages.msgSnippet: Hmm...I see. I asked some people from my school about what they know about the samurai, and most of them, if not all, told me things that they probably got by
messages.messageBody:
Hmm...I see. I asked some people from my school about what they know about the samurai, and most of them, if not all, told me things that they probably got by watching Rurouni Kenshin or by playing games like Onimusha. One or two even told me that they thought the samurai were invincible warriors until they got to see The Last Samurai.

Kyle Segall <klancesegall@...> wrote:
To be honest, I just couldn't help but notice a pattern in idiocy.
EVERYONE was making the same basic mistakes. (The eleventh one came
later, after by some strange coincidence about 3 or 4 people on the
forum starting saying how 'samurai loved and served the emperor with
their life, every single one'. And they've kept coming.) As for my
sources, basically just common real knowledge on the samurai. If I
had to make a bibliography, I suppose it would
read: 'Tony', 'Kitsuno', 'evalerio', 'LTdomer', 'Maikeru', 'nagaeyari
', 'Tsubame'... (sorry if I've left someone's name out!)

--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, Coeli Jimenez
<the_reserve2004@y...> wrote:
>
> Thank you very much! The site is really helpful. Just a question
though, how were you able to come up with all those misconceptions?
Did you use other sources or did you like conduct a survey regarding
what people thought about the samurai?
>
> Kyle Segall <klancesegall@y...> wrote:
>
> I'm the author. You've got full permission to use it.
>

messages.subject: Re: Research
messages.msgSnippet: ... Anything to keep the demons at bay.
messages.messageBody:
--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, Nate Ledbetter
<ltdomer98@y...> wrote:
>
> --- Coeli Jimenez <the_reserve2004@y...>
> wrote:
>
> >
> > Thanks...that would help greatly with the "Western
> > Conceptions" part of my paper. But I was wondering
> > if there are any sites on the misconceptions and
> > truths anime (e.g. Rurouni Kenshin), video games
> > (e.g. Samurai Showdown), and fictional books (e.g.
> > Legend of the 5 Rings) on the samurai bring.
>
> Specifically detailing each and every
> mistake/misconception in each of those? No, I don't
> think there is. Sounds like that's the work you need
> to do for your paper. Though I'm sure we'd all love to
> see it once you're done, and Kitsuno may be even
> willing to post it on his website.
>
> nate
>

Anything to keep the demons at bay.

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Research
messages.msgSnippet: ... Specifically detailing each and every mistake/misconception in each of those? No, I don t think there is. Sounds like that s the work you need to do for
messages.messageBody:
--- Coeli Jimenez <the_reserve2004@...>
wrote:

>
> Thanks...that would help greatly with the "Western
> Conceptions" part of my paper. But I was wondering
> if there are any sites on the misconceptions and
> truths anime (e.g. Rurouni Kenshin), video games
> (e.g. Samurai Showdown), and fictional books (e.g.
> Legend of the 5 Rings) on the samurai bring.

Specifically detailing each and every
mistake/misconception in each of those? No, I don't
think there is. Sounds like that's the work you need
to do for your paper. Though I'm sure we'd all love to
see it once you're done, and Kitsuno may be even
willing to post it on his website.

nate

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Research
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks...that would help greatly with the Western Conceptions part of my paper. But I was wondering if there are any sites on the misconceptions and truths
messages.messageBody:
Thanks...that would help greatly with the "Western Conceptions" part of my paper. But I was wondering if there are any sites on the misconceptions and truths anime (e.g. Rurouni Kenshin), video games (e.g. Samurai Showdown), and fictional books (e.g. Legend of the 5 Rings) on the samurai bring.

wrote:

> misconceptions on the samurai, especially in anime,
> movies, books, video games and the like. I am
> writing a research paper on this topic and I badly
> need ideas.
